Ok, Peter Frampton was amazing on the guitar. For those of you who love the guitar I sujest you listen to one of his songs. But, STYX IS THE GREATEST BAND!!!!!!! I know most of you expected Styx to be old and crippled by now, but it has been more than 4 decades ago since Styx started (so they must be in thier late 40's, early 50's, or late 50's) but they were dancing around up there jumping over the equipment, doing highkicks, and sound exactly like they were in their 30's! Their voices even sound exactly the same! The person who played the keyboard (and did a lot of the lead singing) is officially my new hero. He's also really amusing. Randomly in the middle of the concert he turned to the rest of Styx and said, 'Well, we know you can rock, but can you...rag-time?' And he started playing rag-time on the keyboard and everyone on stage started square dancing. And all of Styx was steaming hot, with their tight, tight, tight, tight pants, esp. the keyboardist who had the tighest pants of all, and...well, I'll just stop there, for all of your sakes. It was awsome though, cause at first we had these really good seats, but the controls were right in front of us and the guy working it was standing right in front of us. We asked for better seats, and we got our own booth! The audience mainly consisted of beer belly, balding with long hair (that they probably grew out just for this concert), men that desperately needed to shave and brought thier wives (and really small children) along. The strange thing was, I didn't see anybody my age there. They were all either men and women and their really small children. I felt alone, but that was ok, I still had a great time. I saw a few guys around 18 years old (which was the closest to my age I saw) kept on passing the booth and winking and looking at me. I mean, they weren't horrible looking, but I knew it was just becasue they would either have to settle for me, or one of the Nas Car dad's sluts in thier 50's. There were a lotta drunk people. The guy in the booth in front of us was either on drugs or REALLY drunk (I think it was drugs). He kept dangling over the back of his seat and rolling his eyes and would sometimes curl up in a ball because the noise was too loud for him. Meh...The woman in the booth behind us though, was REALLY drunk. She had his high-pitched nazal voice and kept screeching into our ears, 'Play Lorelei!!' Yes it is a good song but it was getting to my head...I'm kinda glad that they never played that song, just to piss her off. 3 songs I wish they played that they didn't: The Best of Times, Lorelei, and Mr. Roboto (I didn't care so much about the last one). Oh, and I got a Styx Tour t-shirt! :) In the end I lost my sense of sight (because of the blinding show lights and from leaving my glasses on so long), my sense of hearing (from the huge speakers and Styx is a loud band), my voice (from all the screaming and singing), and I lost my entire sense of sense...wait a minute...Besides all the drunk people...the Styx concert was the greatest...all because of the keyboardist with those tight, tight, tight pants, and those...*ahem*...sorry...I shall conclude with...
